result.execSummary:
The defendant Colleen Rae Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Undecided
State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant Colleen Rae Thompson in court with attorney Jeffery Joy and appears in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:52 PM. Called 15CF88, 15CM95, 15CF126, 16CF69, 16CF141, 16CF168 and 17CF04. State - 17CF04 - believes PH is being waived today and going to plea and sentencing on all 7 files. Thompson and Joy agree, has not filled out waiver of PH form for stated reasons (pleading). Court does verbal waiver of PH collaquey, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Joy waives further reading and will be pleading to case. State - have complied with victim notification requirements wherever necessary with no VIS or request for restitution - 15CM95 - count #1 - DRI, #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $500 fine plus costs, #3 - plead G as alleged with $300.00 fine plus C&S; 15CF88 - counts #1 and #3 are to be DRI, #2 - plead G as alleged with 180 days jail, fine of $1000.00 plus C&S; 15CF126 - #1 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $1000.00 fine plus costs, counts #2 and #3 are to be DRI; 16CF69 - plead G to counts #1, #3 and #4 as alleged, counts #2, #5 and #6 are to be DRI, #1 - 120 days jail - consecutive to count jail time on count #2 of 15CF88, $300 fine plus C&S, #3 - $300 fine plus C&S, #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years  - consecutive to jail on 15CF88 and 16CF69, conditions will be stated later; 16CF141 - plead G to count #1 as alleged and remaining counts to be DRI (#2, #3, #4, #5 and #6) - $300 fine plus C&S; 16CF168 - plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, counts #3, #4 and #5 to be DRI, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years - running consecutive to jail terms previoulsy mentioned - asking for additional jail term of 365 days of conditionl jail time with Joy free to argue for not less than 6 months; 17CF04 - count #1 - plead G as alleged and place on probation for 3 years, counts #2 and #3 both to be amended to county ordinances of bail jumping with fine of $1000.00 plus C&S on each count; other conditions to include: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, obtain psychological evaluation and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or class B establishments, acquire HS disploma of equivalaent if she does not have one, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider. Joy and Thompson agree. Court makes sure defendant knows what it means for a charge to be DRI. Court - 15CF126 - #2 and #3 are DRI; 16CF168 - counts #3, #4 and #5 are DRI; 15CF88 - counts #1 and #3 - DRI; 15CF95 - #1- DRI. Court 16CF141 - DRI counts #2, #3, #4, #5 and #6; 16CF69. counts #2, #5 and #6 are to be DRI; 15CF95 - count #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO; 15CF126 - amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO; 17CF04 - amends counts #2 and #3 to county ordinances of BJ, pleads G to both counts as amended, finds G of both counts, fine of $1000.00 on each count - 60 DTP/CO. Thompson pleads G to count #1 on 17CF04, 16CF168 - pleads G to count #1 as alleged and #2 as alleged, 15CF88 - pleads G to count #2 as alleged, 15CF95 - pleads G to count #3 as alleged, 16CF141 - pleads G to count #1 as alleged, 16CF69 - pleads G to count #1 as alleged, count #3 as alleged and to count #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations and asks for the 1 year jail on 16CF168. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations and asks for 180 days jail on 16CF168 - states credit as: 120 days on 15CF88 and 31 days credit on 16CF69. Thompson makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF88 - count #2 - impose 180 days in FC jail - credit for 180 days served, $1000.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP/CO - consecutive to all other jail sentences; 16CF69 - count #1 - 120 days in FC jail - consecutive to 15CF88 on count #2 - any unused credit to be applied (31 days), fine of $300.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, count #3 - fine of $300.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of - consecutive : AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and entry into any bars or taverns, anger management and follow thry, psychological assessment and follow thru, 200 hours of community service, attend at least one AA/NA or similar program each week, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, take all medications as prescribed, costs - 60 DTP/CO; 16CF141 - count #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs - 60 FDTP/CO; 17CF04 - #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent with each other but consecutive to jail times on 15CF88 and 16CF69, same terms and conditions of probation with no additional community service, costs - 60 DTP/CO; 16CF168 - counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other and to other probations but consecutive to jail terms imposed, same conditions, costs - 60 DTP/CO, 1 year in FC jail - last 6 months will be stayed if all court costs/fines are paid in full and have a full time job/school otherwise must serve the last 6 months, huber and good time allowed on all jail sentences and eligible for community service to 973.03(3) on straight jail time sentences and 973.09(7m) on conditional jail time ordered; 15CF95 - count #3 - $300.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample, no voting rights and no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on April 17, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Colleen Rae Thompson in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Colleen Rae Thompson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:04 PM. Called 15CF88, 16CF69, 16CF168, 15CF126, 15CM95 and 16CF141. State - here for PH's on all of the felony cases and believes the CM is STC. Case 15CF126, 16CF141 and 16CF168 are going to be waivers and will proceeding on the other PH's. Thompson agrees. Court has waiver of PH for cases 16CF69, 15CF126, 16CF141 and 16CF168, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause on all of them, binds over for trial on all of them. State has filed Information's on all of those cases that mirror the complaints. Joy has all three Information's, waives reading of them, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. State proceeds on PH for 15CF88 and calls Deputy Chris Tanner. Tanner sworn in at 1:09 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:12 PM). Tanner excused at 1:23 PM. Court finds probable cause on this matter and binds over for trial. State files Information that DOES NOT mirror the complaint (count #2 is different). Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bond on all matters, accepts NG pleas to all counts on all cases, sets CM case for STC and other matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on February 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on December 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Colleen Rae Thompson appears via video from FOSO with attorney Jeffery Joy appearing by phone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CF88, 15CM95, 16CF69, 16CF141, 16CF168, 15CF126. Called 9:16 AM. Court reviews all files, questions Joy. Joy will be representing her on all cases and suggests that he get all complaints and review with defendant and asks for PH to be set, waiving time limits. Court sets each of the felonies for PH, time limits waived. Joy enters NG pleas on CM cases. Court will accept NG pleas on CM cases and bond will be continued on each case. Set PH on all CF cases and STC on CM cases.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Colleen Rae Thompson in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:44 AM. Calld 16CF168, 15CF88, 16CF141, 16CF69, 15CM95, and 15CM126. Thompson informs Court that she has not retained counsel yet, has contacted Amy Ferguson. Court will continue bond on all matters and gives another court date but warns on returning without an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Colleen Rae Thompson in court, in custody and without attorney.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10 am. All cases with warrants are called. 16CF69, 15CF88, 15CF126, 15CF95 and 16CF141. Was in court earlier - was arrested. Does not have attorney at this time. Court explains the procedure for forfeiting bond. Defendant understands. Defendant intends on getting her own attorney. Has left voicemail for attorney Ferguson and has not received call back as of this time. Court will set all for status. Defendant will get own attorney and needs a week. State requests significant cash bond. Court imposes bond on each case of bond amount previously ordered on warrants $3000 on each case. Simono makes statement and defendant's father wants to make statement. Court allows father to make statement and asks court for signature bond for stated reasons. Court can make the argument to the court on bond when she gets attorney and get a hearing date to review bond. Court will hear bond sooner if she gets attorney. Set all cases for status 8/24/16 @ 10 am.
